Executive Assistant Job at TeamAce Limited




        
    

        
        TeamAce Limited - Our client, a reputable Quick Service Restaurant (QSR), is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As the Executive Assistant, you will serve as the right-hand to the Founder, providing high-level administrative and operational support.
	You will manage schedules, coordinate projects, handle communication, and ensure the Founder’s time and focus are optimized for driving business growth across multiple initiatives.


Responsibilities

	Manage the Founder’s calendar, meetings, travel logistics, and correspondence
	Coordinate projects and campaigns, ensuring deadlines and KPIs are achieved
	Act as a liaison with internal teams, vendors, and external stakeholders
	Prepare reports, documents, and presentations, ensuring accuracy and professionalism.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Communications, or related discipline
	Minimum of 3 years of experience as an Executive Assistant, Chief of Staff, or Project Manager
	Highly proactive, organized, and tech-savvy (Google Workspace, project management tools)
	Strong communication, problem-solving, and discretion handling sensitive information.


Salary
N250,000 - N350,000 monthly.

Quality Assurance and Quality Control Officer Job at Sobaz Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Sobaz Nigeria Limited is a wholly Nigerian-owned company with operations spanning the full value chain of the oil and gas industry. Our activities cover both wholesale and retail distribution of petroleum products, including PMS, DPK, AGO, LPG, CNG, LNG, LPFO, HPFO, base oil, bitumen, and condensates.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



In addition to distribution, we provide comprehensive storage and haulage services for these products, alongside the trading and importation of petroleum commodities to meet market demand. With a fleet of over 350 tanker trucks and a network of more than 80 strategically located retail outlets nationwide, we are optimally positioned to deliver reliable energy solutions across Nigeria. Our unwavering commitment is to ensure that every consumer enjoys our brand promise of consistent availability, premium quality, and competitive pricing.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance and Quality Control Officer
Job Location: Port Harcourt, River
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Quality Assurance & Compliance:


	Develop, implement, and monitor QAQC policies, procedures, and standards across all departments.
	Ensure compliance with local and international regulatory requirements (e.g., DPR/NMDPRA, OSHA, ISO standards).
	Conduct regular inspections and quality checks on fuel handling, storage, and distribution operations.
	Verify that truck maintenance activities meet safety, reliability, and environmental standards.


Auditing & Monitoring:


	Plan and execute internal quality audits across all business units (operations, HR, finance, IT, etc.).
	Work with the audit team to ensure accurate record-keeping and compliance with financial and operational controls.
	Identify gaps, risks, and non-conformities, and recommend corrective and preventive actions.


Process Improvement:


	Develop quality performance indicators (KPIs) to measure efficiency and compliance.
	Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance operational efficiency, safety, and customer satisfaction.
	Support automation and digital transformation initiatives in line with IT best practices.


Health, Safety & Environment (HSE) Oversight:


	Collaborate with HSE officers to enforce safety protocols in depots, truck yards, and maintenance workshops.
	Monitor waste management, pollution control, and adherence to environmental standards.
	Participate in incident investigations and root cause analysis.


Cross-Departmental Support:


	Work with HR/Admin to ensure recruitment, training, and employee practices align with quality standards.
	Collaborate with Finance to ensure compliance with audit controls and reporting accuracy.
	Provide guidance to IT for data protection, system reliability, and compliance with cybersecurity standards.


Reporting & Documentation:


	Prepare regular QAQC reports for management review.
	Maintain updated quality manuals, SOPs, and compliance records.
	Ensure documentation meets ISO and regulatory requirements.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / Bachelor's Degree with 5 years of experience.


Salary
N200,000 - N450,000 per month. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@sobazgroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
